alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 8:10AM CDT until May 17 at 4:13AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria, Fort Bend, Harris and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 759 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Western Pearland, Sugar Land, Missouri City, Stafford, Bellaire, West University Place, Tomball, Jersey Village, northwestern Manvel, Hunters Creek Village, Bunker Hill Village, Piney Point Village, Spring Branch North, Spring Branch West, Spring Valley, Addicks Park Ten, Afton Oaks / River Oaks Area, Memorial Park, Greater Heights and Greenway / Upper Kirby Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
